Description: Light-brown pottery pilgrim-flask. On side (a), within a border of large studs, is an eagle, its wings raised, standing to right. On side (b) is a cross within a wreath. The mouth is lost.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Late Roman, about AD 480-650.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3460)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
